freenet.node
Class FNPPacketMangler

java.lang.Object
  freenet.node.FNPPacketMangler
All Implemented Interfaces:
IncomingPacketFilter, OutgoingPacketMangler
public class FNPPacketMangler
extends Object
implements OutgoingPacketMangler, IncomingPacketFilter

Author:
amphibian Encodes and decodes packets for FNP. This includes encryption, authentication, and may later include queueing etc. (that may require some interface changes in IncomingPacketFilter).

Method Detail

start

public void start()
Start up the FNPPacketMangler. By the time this is called, all objects will have been constructed, but not all will have been started yet.

process

public void process(byte[] buf,
                    int offset,
                    int length,
                    Peer peer,
                    long now)
Decrypt and authenticate packet. Then feed it to USM.checkFilters. Packets generated should have a PeerNode on them. Note that the buffer can be modified by this method.

Specified by:
process in interface IncomingPacketFilter
Parameters:
buf - The buffer to read from. Note that this may be reused later on; any data to keep must be copied.
offset - The offset to start reading from.
length - The length in bytes to read.
peer - The peer which sent us the packet. We only know the Peer because it's incoming; we are supposed to create or find PeerContext's for the Message's.
now - The exact time at which the packet was received.

processOutgoingOrRequeue

public boolean processOutgoingOrRequeue(MessageItem[] messages,
                                        PeerNode pn,
                                        boolean dontRequeue,
                                        boolean onePacket)
                                 throws BlockedTooLongException
Description copied from interface: OutgoingPacketMangler
Build one or more packets and send them, from a whole bunch of messages. If any MessageItem's are formatted already, they will be sent as single packets. Any packets which cannot be sent will be requeued on the PeerNode.

Specified by:
processOutgoingOrRequeue in interface OutgoingPacketMangler
onePacket - If true, we will only send one packet, and will requeue any messages that don't fit in that single packet.
Returns:
True if we sent a packet.
Throws:
BlockedTooLongException

processOutgoing

public int processOutgoing(byte[] buf,
                           int offset,
                           int length,
                           SessionKey tracker,
                           short priority)
                    throws KeyChangedException,
                           NotConnectedException,
                           PacketSequenceException,
                           WouldBlockException
Description copied from interface: OutgoingPacketMangler
Build a packet and send it. From a Message recently converted into byte[], but with no outer formatting.

Specified by:
processOutgoing in interface OutgoingPacketMangler
Returns:
Total size including UDP headers of the sent packet.
Throws:
PacketSequenceException
WouldBlockException
KeyChangedException
NotConnectedException

processOutgoingPreformatted

public int processOutgoingPreformatted(byte[] buf,
                                       int offset,
                                       int length,
                                       SessionKey tracker,
                                       int packetNumber,
                                       AsyncMessageCallback[] callbacks,
                                       short priority)
                                throws KeyChangedException,
                                       NotConnectedException,
                                       PacketSequenceException,
                                       WouldBlockException
Description copied from interface: OutgoingPacketMangler
Encrypt a packet, prepend packet acks and packet resend requests, and send it. The provided data is ready-formatted, meaning that it already has the message length's and message counts.

Specified by:
processOutgoingPreformatted in interface OutgoingPacketMangler
Parameters:
buf - Buffer to read data from.
offset - Point at which to start reading.
length - Number of bytes to read.
tracker - The SessionKey to use to encrypt the packet and send it to the associated PeerNode.
packetNumber - If specified, force use of this particular packet number. Means this is a resend of a dropped packet.
Returns:
The size of the sent packet.
Throws:
KeyChangedException - If the primary key changes while we are trying to send this packet.
NotConnectedException - If the node is not connected.
PacketSequenceException
WouldBlockException - If we cannot allocate a packet number because it would block.
